title: Evolutionary history of stony corals suggests that some could be resilient to climate change
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03362-4

Climate change is threatening coral reefs worldwide. A comprehensive tree-like representation of evolutionary relationships between stony coral species ca…
body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03362-4 Climate change is threatening coral reefs worldwide. A comprehensive tree-like representation of evolutionary relationships between stony coral species captures the group’s spectrum of traits. It shows that shallow-water species that have mutually beneficial relationships with microalgae have been more vulnerable and less resilient than their deep-water counterparts across past adverse environmental events.
